contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Ordinary Average Guy | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Joe Walsh]] | Cover = Joe Walsh - Ordinary Average Guy.jpg | Released = April 23, 1991 | Recorded = August, 1990 | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]] | Length = 47:44 | Label = [[Epic Records|Epic]] | Producer = [[Joe Walsh]], [[Joe Vitale (musician)|Joe Vitale]] | Last album = ''[[MTV Unplugged (Joe Walsh)|MTV Unplugged]]''<br />(1990) | This album = '''''Ordinary Average Guy'''''<br />(1991) | Next album = ''[[Songs for a Dying Planet]]''<br />(1992) }} '''''Ordinary Average Guy''''' is the ninth studio [[album]] by [[Joe Walsh]], released in 1991 (see [[1991 in music]]). ==Reception== {{Album ratings | rev1 =[[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|2|5}} <ref name="AM">{{cite web |first=Vincent |last=Jeffries |title= ''Ordinary Average Guy'' > Review |url={{Allmusic|class=album|id= r21450 |pure_url=yes}} |publisher=[[Allmusic]] |accessdate=July 9, 2011}}</ref> }} Writing for [[Allmusic]], critic Vincent Jeffries wrote of the album "This collection of nostalgia, decent balladry, and quirky anthems probably reinforced any notions of Joe Walsh's creative decline... this reflective, sometimes half-hearted effort bellies a weariness that's both sad and difficult to appreciate as this master goes through the motions."<ref name="AM" /> ==Track listing== All songs by Joe Walsh, except where noted. #"Two Sides to Every Story" (Rick Rosas, Joe Walsh) – 3:24 #"Ordinary Average Guy" – 4:12 #"The Gamma Goochee" (Mangiagli) – 4:29 #"All of a Sudden" – ([[Jimmy Jamison]], Joe Walsh)4:56 #"Alphabetical Order" ([[Joe Vitale]], Walsh) – 4:58 #"Look at Us Now" – ([[Jimmy Jamison]], Joe Walsh) 4:55 #"I'm Actin' Different" – 4:31 #"Up All Night" (Vitale, Walsh) – 3:54 #"You Might Need Somebody" (O'Byrne, [[Tom Snow (songwriter)|Tom Snow]]) – 4:30 #"Where I Grew up (Prelude to School Days)" – 2:37 #"School Days" (Vitale) – 5:18 ==Personnel== *Joe Walsh – [[guitar]], [[keyboard instrument|keyboards]], [[vocals]] *[[Waddy Wachtel]] – guitar *Rick Rosas – bass guitar *George Perry – bass guitar *[[Chad Cromwell]] – drums, percussion *[[Joe Vitale (musician)|Joe Vitale]] – keyboards, drums, percussion, bass guitar, vocals *[[Paul Shaffer]] – piano, keyboards *Wally Cullis – drums, percussion *Larry Otis – saxophone *Ringo – backing vocals *Al Paris – backing vocals *Kelley Hurt – backing vocals *[[Jimi Jamison]] – backing vocals *Jeff Rogers – backing vocals *Smokey Wendell – manager ===Others=== *Gary Belz *Kevin Buell *Michael Caplan *Mark Chernoff *[[David Fishof]] *Ken Frank *Wally Franson *Bruce Garfield *Richard 'Kush" Griffith *[[Herbs_(band)|Herbs]] *Mark Herman *Ken Kraus *Steve Lawrence *Lucy *Turley Richards *Alan Rogan *Ed Sanford ==Production== *Producers: Joe Walsh, Joe Vitale *Executive producer: Scott Maclellan *Engineers: Jim Nipar, Dave Reynolds, [[Bill Szymczyk]] *Assistant engineers: Tim Ray, Jim Stabile, Johnny Walls *Mixing: Dave Reynolds *Mixing assistants: Tim Ray, Johnny Walls *Mastering: Vladimir Meller *Art direction: David Coleman *Photography: Patrick Cullie, Alan Messer ==Charts== '''Album''' - [[Billboard magazine|Billboard]] (North America) {| class="wikitable" !Year !Chart !Position |- |1991 |The Billboard 200 |align="center"|112 |} '''Singles''' - Billboard (North America) {| class="wikitable" !Year !Single !Chart !Position |- |rowspan="2"|1991 |"All of a Sudden" |Mainstream Rock Tracks |align="center"|13 |- |"Ordinary Average Guy" |Mainstream Rock Tracks |align="center"|3 |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Joe Walsh}} [[Category:Joe Walsh albums]] [[Category:1991 albums]]
